meanings.english_definition: (Latin) first-person singular present active indicative of cohaereō: I cohere, I stick together.

etymology.value: From the Latin verb 'cohaereō', meaning 'to stick together, cohere, be connected'.

verb_forms.present_active_indicative: cohaereō, cohaerēs, cohaeret, cohaerēmus, cohaeretis, cohaerent
verb_forms.imperfect_active_indicative: cohaerēbam, cohaerēbās, cohaerēbat, cohaerēbāmus, cohaerēbātis, cohaerēbant
verb_forms.future_active_indicative: cohaerēbō, cohaerēbis, cohaerēbit, cohaerēbimus, cohaerēbitis, cohaerēbunt
verb_forms.perfect_active_indicative: cohaesī, cohaesistī, cohaesit, cohaesimus, cohaesistis, cohaesērunt or cohaesēre
verb_forms.pluperfect_active_indicative: cohaeseram, cohaeseras, cohaeserat, cohaeseramus, cohaeseratis, cohaeserant
verb_forms.future_perfect_active_indicative: cohaesero, cohaeseris, cohaeserit, cohaeserimus, cohaeseritis, cohaeserint

usage_notes.explanation: 'cohaereo' is the first-person singular present active indicative form of the Latin verb 'cohaereō'. It is used to express that the speaker coheres or sticks together in the present.
